title: Games are too snowbally and Riot wants to make them more snowbally
body:
With the proposed cannon minion change, the stated goal is to make games more snowbally.

Games are already insanely snowbally.

I don't want to quit League but i actually might, not gonna lie. I don't have fun in like 80% of my games as it is.

replies.body: i will freaking uninstall if riot actually makes the situation worse, i'm sick and tired of having to carry 3-4 retards every game and im forced to play overpowered braindead champions that can solo carry and give up on playing a fun champion, i can't have fun like i used to.. it's all about picking the meta and hope your allies aren't disabled glass cannons that melt and feed the entire enemy team until we are forced to lose.

Feels like there's some false advertisement going on here.

The stated goal is to make contesting and fighting your opponent in lane more valuable and available. An accepted risk point is that this _could_ cause lane matchups to be more snowbally. At the same time, a _hopeful_ benefit is that players that want to express their individual skill over their lane opponent now have more opportunities to do so because there are predictable, important times in the minion formations where their opponent feels more compelled to expose themselves to risk.

Fair enough. I was also tilted while I posted this thread. I keep having games where some assassin pops off and snowballs off of a few early misteps by somebody on my team. Right now my MMR in normals is pretty tanked so it might be that but I think the game is currently too volatile.

I don't like that you apparently don't find it to be a big deal. Like you're calling it an "accepted risk". I think it would make the game more fun and less toxic if you cared more about volatility and hard snowballing.

IDK I think my issue stems from the fact that a lot of champions are designed to depend on snowballing. Like give Draven 1 kill early and you're gonna have to seriously respect him for a while. But if he doesn't get a kill early he has trouble making an impact. Get camped mid against a Zed and he can easily snowball off 1-2 ganks. Then get raged at by your jungler who didn't care to help out.

Volatility is toxic.
The problem is this view point isn't that much one sided. It's just that most people on NA board do like longer games.

It's not an issue of game length for me. I just don't like how a lot of games snowball off of a few early plays.

And the prospect of lane matchups becoming more extreme is terrifying because it's already common to fall behind insanely far off one gank that forces you to miss a shitload of CS or creates an opportunity for the opponent to freeze at a good time for them.

Like wave timing is already insanely important.
It really feels like balance is done in a vacuum these days. That's all I am gonna say, otherwise I'll just rant.

For me it was season 4 that was the best season for League, there was a wide array of junglers to choose from since Spirit Stone gave back 8% damage dealt to jungle mobs as HP and 4% as mana, while every lane had equal agency in how the game would end up. You wouldn't have issues where supports were too overpowered and mitigate your entire damage combo's, ADC's still needed 3 items to reach their lategame and the items weren't cheap either, Mid-laners could roam top or bottom and make plays and take objectives off of those plays, Top wasn't treated like an island the champion picks in that lane would have great influence in teamfights, and junglers wouldn't need to be so gank reliant to get their powerspikes because the jungle respawned fast enough to where they could keep up in lvls.

That to me was one of the most balanced times in League.

Given that snowballing has made the game felt like shit for more than 3 months, and you guys are just now addressing it and you even admit that this change may make the problem worse, doesn't exactly inspire confidence guys know what you are doing or have the ability to recognize SERIOUS problems until you've been screamed at for extent periods of time or had famous streamers having serious hissy fits to see the writing that's clearly on the wall for anyone who plays the game.

I appreciate game balance can be difficult, I was a modder for BF1942, and things we did to balance maps didn't always go how we planned, but geezus, the game has needed major changes since the season started to make losses not feel like being forced to eat your own excrement for 15 minutes before your team realizes that OMG we're down 20 kills and 10 objectives, we should surrender. 

I mean for gods sake there's been calls for a surrender at 10 that have reached the front page here that are being taken seriously.

Another guy has admitted afking to force a surrender vote in another thread because his team wouldn't surrender and since comebacks are basically impossible there is no point in trying, and instead of storm of downvotes and backlash like they'd get in any other season, people are admitting maybe the guy has a point, and others even stating its better to AFK and play on another account than keep trying on a clear loss, and they've been upvoted as well.

How clear does the problem need to be for you to say hey, sorry league fans, we fucked up hard this season, we're gonna do our best to fix it, instead of this wishywashy, "Oh hey we've noticed this might be a problem, we're thinking about how to fix it and we'll get to in a couple patches or so... maybe".

If you want to add skill expression back into the game, then what about you reverting these dumb ass changes you've made throughout the two last seasons instead of adding fuel to the fire like you're doing now? 

I'm sorry my man, I'm just tired of your balance team. They're not doing the game any favors. Wouldn't be surprised if this game is close to dead in 1-2 years. The balance team is legit anti-fun.

So forcing us to fight over an already limited gold income that was the only reason we were already fighting is somehow going to fix the issue?

Let’s be honest if it wasn’t for the minion gold I’d already be afk under tower for conditioning to activate at 10 minutes.

If you want players to fight more deload kills in exp and gold so that it doesn’t make the game feel unwinnable after 1 death.

Sure it devalues early game aggression, but we don’t need as much as we currently have.

QFT

One death in the first 5m of the game and when that player gets back into lane, the enemy is +2 levels....
If the Enemy was lvl 6 they have ~20s and their ult is back up to kill you again.

So Ether you hide under turret not farming and spam ping assist or spam ping MIA.

This is in part why I changed to playing Fizz mid because no mater what I can farm with ease if Im ahead or behind.  Mages are hurt a TON in farming because it cost so much mana and then under turret you cant farm vs the turret.

However it buffs ADC class because they scale the most with gold

So as far as I understand, this will make it so just clearing waves and ignoring the opponent will be harder?

I'm not trying to sound disrespectful or anything but don't you think that this will make the jungler even stronger (especially in the mid lane)?

The first thing I ask myself when I see the change is "WHY do people actually do that?"
Why don't they interact with the opponent more?

Is it because they WANT to not do anything other than push waves until laning phase is over?
Highly unlikely, this isn't an engaging, interesting nor fun way to play the game.

So it's not that they don't want to, lets go a bit further and think about what happens WHEN they do it.

"Viktor is in the middle of the lane trying to poke out Ahri that just used her spells to clear the wave, so naturally he steps up a bit to do so. 
It was very successful, Ahri has lost 30% of her HP with very little retaliation on Viktor, Sejuani is here.... wait what?
Yes Sejuani is here, Viktor is dead"

Could it be that they simply just can't do it?
Because as soon as they interact with the opponent they just die.

Now this is an extreme situation yeah but generally speaking this may just be the reason why interacting with your opponent is just not worth the risk.

So reducing the Junglers presence and his power might be the solution. I'm not saying nerf them to the ground, they can have better scaling if their early game is nerfed but getting them out of lanes or making their ganks less powerful may be a way to approach this issue.

This could also solve the solo-carrying problem people are having. For you to be able to solo carry as a solo laner you don't need to win a 1 v 1, you need to be able to 2 v 1 the enemy solo laner and the enemy jungler. 
Now this isn't something new, the jungler existed for a long ass time but what changed is the junglers power in the early game to shut down these leads the solo laner can use to solo carry 
(There are other reasons why solo carrying got a lot harder but this is another topic we aren't discussing right now, unless you want to of course)

I just really don't think FORCING them to interact more is the play here. This would be a temporary solution to a permanent problem and these rarely work out well.
Prime example: {{champion:114}} and {{item:3076}} 

Of course there are other factors like that mana isn't even a thing anymore. You weren't able to just push the wave all day, if you did you were OOM in like 4 - 5 waves.

Edit: I know you have plans to reduce jungle power/presence in the early game but then this change would be double dipping which would result in late game oriented champions getting a huge nerf and all sorts of collateral damage (if the jungle changes go through that is).

The minion changes are aimed at making roaming more risky (less gold in the long run for those that get ahead, more lost if they don't succeed) and making early farming a bit more important. 


They're also looking to take away the burn damage on towers from red buff, so as to make sure tower sieging isn't so easy for only 2 people. I really don't think it'll make games snowball anymore than they already do, but could extend the natural average game time an extra 2-3 minutes.

They specifically mentioned that they want to dial back on the 'push and roam' strategies effectiveness, particularly in the midlane where the dominant champions right now just hard shove and then go gank a side lane.
